alert.note: Alert for Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 18 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Colleton. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 740 AM EDT, Colleton County Emergency Management reported that flooding continues along Ireland Creek in Walterboro. - Pictures provided by Colleton County Emergency Management show that flooding continues along Ireland Creek in Walterboro. However, water level observations from the USGS river gauge located on the Highway 15 bridge show that the creek level continues to fall and the extent of the flooding will continue to decrease through the morning. Water is still flooding portions of Ireland Creek Drive, Ivanhoe Road, Forest Hills Drive, and Sweat Street but these roads should again become passable later today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
